translations.translation: Which one of your Lord's blessings do you then dispute?
How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
So, which of your Lord's bounties will you doubt?”
About which of the bounties of your Lord can they persistently dispute?
So O listener! Which favour of your Lord will you doubt?
Then which of the graces of your Lord will you doubt
Which of your Lord's benefits will you then dispute about?
Then which of thy Lord's bounties disputest thou?
Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord, canst thou dispute?
On which then of your Lord's signs do you cast doubt?
Which then of thy Lord's benefits wilt thou doubt?
Then which of the bounties of your Lord will you dispute?
Then which of the gifts of thy Lord, (O man,) wilt thou dispute about?
Then which of the Graces of your Lord (O man!) will you doubt.
So which then of your Lord's favors do you dispute?
So which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?
Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?
[53:55] Then which of the bounties of your Lord, [which of] His graces, [graces] which indicate His Oneness and power, do you dispute?, do you have doubt about, O man, or deny?

(Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord) which of the blessings of your Lord, man-this refers to all human beings except Muhammad (pbuh)-(canst thou dispute) can you deny that it is not from your Lord?

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { فَبِأَيِّ آلاۤءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ } فالآلاءُ: النُّعماءُ واحدُها الَّى
 وتَتَمارى: أي تَشكُّ

translations.translation:
And His saying, {So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?} So the favors are the bounties and one of them is that


And you continue: meaning you are in doubt.
